chapter.title: Protecting Against Malware With &clamsap;
chapter.para: &clamsap; integrates the &clamav; anti-malware toolkit into &netweaver; and &sap; Mobile Platform applications. &clamsap; is a shared library that links between &clamav; and the &netweaver; Virus Scan Interface (NW-VSI). The version of &clamsap; shipped with &productname; &productnumber; supports NW-VSI version 2.0.

important.title: Avoid false positive reports for large files exeeding maximum file size
important.para: By default, &clamav; is not scanning files exeeding various limits like file sizes, nesting level, or scan time. Such files are reported as "OK". The current default settings for the &clamav; virus scan engine in the clamscan commandline tool and the clamd scan daemon are set in a way that:

listitem.para: Files and archives are scanned, but only up to the configured or default limits for size, nesting level, scan time, etc.
The scan engine reports these files as being "OK".
This could potentially allow attackers to bypass the virus scanning.

important.para: Alerts can be enabled to set the --alert-exceeds-max=yes option on the clamscan commandline or via AlertExceedsMax TRUE in clamd.conf for daemon based scans. Settings these options will cause a "FOUND" report of status type Heuristics.Limits.Exceeded. You need to handle such files differently in front-ends or processing of reports.
Before enabling the alert, ensure that front-ends will not suddenly quarantine or remove those files.

sect1.title: Creating a Virus Scanner Group in &nw;

step.para: Log in to the &nw; installation through the GUI. Do not log in as a DDIC or SAP* user, because the virus scanner needs to be configured cross-client.
Create a Virus Scanner Group using the transaction VSCANGROUP.

textobject.phrase: Edit View Scanner Group with editable table

step.para: Confirm the message This table is cross-client by clicking the check mark. The table is now editable.
Select the first empty row. In the text box Scanner Group, specify CLAMSAPVSI. Under Group Text, specify CLAMSAP.
Make sure that Business Add-in is not checked.

textobject.phrase: Edit View Scanner Group with editable table

step.para: In the &nw; GUI, call the transaction VSCAN.
Confirm the message This table is cross-client by clicking the check mark. The table is now editable.

listitem.para: Scanner Group: The name of the scanner group that you set up in (for example: CLAMSAPVSI)
